co.cask.cdap.api.flow.flowlet
Interface Flowlet

All Superinterfaces:
ProgramLifecycle<FlowletContext>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractFlowlet
public interface Flowlet
extends ProgramLifecycle<FlowletContext>

Defines the Flowlet interface. A Flowlet should provide the functionality for initializing and configuring itself.

Method Summary
 FlowletSpecification configure()
          Provides an interface to configure a Flowlet.
 void destroy()
          Destroy is the last thing that gets called before the flowlet is shutdown.
 void initialize(FlowletContext context)
          Initializes a Flowlet.
 

Method Detail

configure

FlowletSpecification configure()
Provides an interface to configure a Flowlet.

This method could possibly be called multiple times and hence should not be used for allocating resources needed at run-time. This method is generally called in configuration phase of the flowlet which happens during application deployment.

The FlowletSpecification returned from this method is available at runtime through the FlowletContext which is given through the initialize(FlowletContext) method.

Returns:
An instance of FlowletSpecification

initialize

void initialize(FlowletContext context)
                throws Exception
Initializes a Flowlet.

This method will be called only once per Flowlet instance..

Specified by:
initialize in interface ProgramLifecycle<FlowletContext>
Parameters:
context - An instance of FlowletContext
Throws:
Exception - If there is any error during initialization.

destroy

void destroy()
Destroy is the last thing that gets called before the flowlet is shutdown. So, if there are any cleanups then they can be specified here.

This method will be called only when there are no more events beings processed by the flowlet.

Specified by:
destroy in interface ProgramLifecycle<FlowletContext>
